alert.note: Alert for Schuyler (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Seneca, northeastern Schuyler and northwestern Tompkins Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Perry City, or 11 miles northeast of Watkins Glen, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ithaca, Enfield, Covert, Trumansburg, Reynoldsville, Mecklenburg, Taughannock Falls, Searsburg, Perry City and Bennettsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Cayuga Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
